lines.content: AI tools (ChatGPT) were used during the development of Fozza to:
- Improve overall code structure and refactor long methods
- Suggest improvements to SLAP (Single Level of Abstraction Principle)
- Review code quality before final submission
All AI-suggested code was reviewed, understood, and modified where necessary before committing.
AI tools were used as a productivity aid to improve development efficiency while maintaining
full understanding of the implemented logic.
This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/fozza.Fozza.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run fozza.Fozza.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
Fozza is a task management chatbot with a JavaFX graphical user interface (GUI).
It allows users to manage tasks efficiently using simple command-based inputs.
All commands are entered in the input field at the bottom of the GUI.
#Adding Todos : Adds a simple task without a date.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have X tasks in the list.
#Adding Deadlines : Adds a task with a deadline.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have X tasks in the list.
#Adding Events : Adds a task that occurs within a time range.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have X tasks in the list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have X tasks in the list.
Here are the tasks in your list:
#Finding Tasks : Searches for tasks containing a keyword.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
#Marking Tasks as Done : Marks a task as completed.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
#Unmarking Tasks : Marks a completed task as not done.
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
#Deleting Tasks : Removes a task from the list.
Now you have X tasks in the list.
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
##Data Storage -  Fozza automatically saves tasks to a local file.
Tasks will be restored when the application is restarted.
